replies.body: They removed the core essence of Aatrox character, just for balance changes.

I definitely agree. I am not an Aatrox main nor do I enjoy playing against him (passive healing with Spirit Visage makes him a monster late game) but I am disappointed with this change. His whole theme is this unkillable darkin that wants to run at you and slice. Also Rito wanting to force changes to champion's themes because of pro/high elo players seems like a slippery slope to me. Whats next? Remove Tahm's devour or make Lucian's R one wave only?

Tldr; not a fan of Aatrox R change. Either revert or nerf him but please don't ruin the theme.
R.I.P leona,

Big time. I just got her Solar Eclipse skin which is the only skin which has a visual indicator for her empowered attacks after casting Solar Flare (Leona glows red). Guess that’s useless now. Super annoying given that it’s an epic skin which released less than a year ago.

A disappointing patch to say the least but its typical of this time of the year, people seem confused about the patches but the trend is pretty simple, short story short, WORLDS is coming up, so Rito wants to capitalize on viewers, best way to do that is make epic one shot champs like {{champion:58}} that look cool to watch meta and the boring ones like {{champion:223}}  and {{champion:266}}  useless, this just leads to more people watching. riot cares more about the viewers then the players {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

singed chnage was not needed at all like he was already in a bad spot and adding the recast makes him feel clunky and even worse in a meta where he has no viable runes and few winning matchups :( not even a compensation buff?

heres to hoping it gets reverted for the sake of enjoying the champ

He did need this though, it was far to easy to hit the button twice and waste mana.

Ultimately Singed needs a rework of some kind, he's obsolete.

he didnt need it imo cause the quick tap was what alowed you to farm early game without wasting too much of your very limited mana pool levels 1-3 

and any decent singed played wont triple tap the q button its fairly easy to manage before now it just feels punishing if anything
Unless you have a twitch in your hand which causes you to press buttons twice very often, and how easy it is to not notice that singed poison isnt on

Why is {{champion:64}}'s new voice over not mentioned in the patch notes?
It's definitely live. 

_(RIP Vic. Clearly 'innocent until proven guilty' has no weighting here)_

It's hard to put into words just how stupid the anti-shielding/healing changes are, the anti-shielding ones in particular. {{champion:53}} ult already does too much damage considering its incredibly low cooldowns late-game, and the last thing {{champion:58}} needs is the ability to negate one of the few ways to defend against him.

Also, 60% healing reduction for *5* seconds? Really? You mention {{item:3123}} but how is that in any way relevant to this idiotic change?

The blitzcrank one imo isnt that big of a deal, its on his ult, and its a 2v2 lane. The renekton one actually just makes it impossible to beat him on a number of champions, and removes a huge portion of counterplay from his trading pattern.
They are still unnecessary, Blitz just adds to his high damage output (which I still think needs to be cut by a third), and yes, the Renekton one is unbelievably stupid.

These {{champion:50}} changes are forcing him to build around his ultimate. He can't poke with that range anymore & late game, 4 seconds between casts on your main dmg spell it too long when it doesn't go thru champs.

RIP {{champion:50}}

Thanks Riot for nerfing my two Support Mains at the same time.  Leona was never broken, and was hardly even played.  I guess you're going to see her less now.  Also, Lux's cooldown refund was a great reward for hitting an amazing combo, maybe you could have lessened the cooldowns instead of removing them entirely.  Now I have to look for a new tank and mage support, except all of them have been nerfed to make Yuumi look better

The W is more of a buff imo and feels like there are much clearer reasons to use the W at a particular time.  Personally, I think taking away from her already quite high base damage and moving that strength into tank stats (since she's a tank and all) makes a lot of sense. Overall I would call it at worst a rebalance and not a nerf. That said, I don't play a lot of Leona (though I do verse her plenty).

As for Lux, that's exactly what they did. Her R cooldown is significantly lower at later ranks and the AP ratio went up, so overall I'd call it a buff to her ult. The Q and W were problematic in lane. She was just way too safe for what is far closer to a kill lane than any other enchanter support. And tbh, the nerfs aren't even all that big, certainly not enough to warrant changing mains if perhaps a new FotM. A good Lux is still going to thrive. For the record, I both play and verse *a lot* of Lux.

That is naturally just my personal opinion.

So am I supposed to build Tahm rageblade and nashors/wits end every game now? I don't understand making it so he can't apply his passive with **any** ability. At least keep it on Q or W. With W at least the long cooldown and ability to apply it to multiple people makes it a trade off for saving to use on someone or trying to get quick stacks for Q.
Electrocute is bugged currently and won't proc

Pretty much all they did was take out all the decision making in the kits, and just make the champs kinda plain, Swains soul mechanic was interesting and fun, one of the main reasons I played him, same goes for a few of these changes lux akali etc, just a pretty trash patch overall, hope it gets reverted tbh
yeah im glad garen and lucian got more skins -.-

Need more 'Vice' Themed skins
Fuck the much needed Teemo changes, we need Miami Vice Teemo
